lead_paragraph: A Colorado organization is teaching financial literacy to those under 22, and thousands have participated in its entrepreneurship programs.

headline.print_headline: Some Kids Sell Lemonade. He Starts a Chain.
headline.main: Some Kids Sell Lemonade. He Starts a Chain.

snippet: A Colorado organization is teaching financial literacy to those under 22, and thousands have participated in its entrepreneurship programs.
abstract: Claire Martin Prototype column focuses on 10-year-old entrepreneur Jack Bonneau, who founded Jack's Stands and Jack's Marketplace in Colorado with $5,000 loan from Young Americans Bank; Bonneau is one of thousands of fledgling child entrepreneurs helped by bank or its companion organization Young Americans Center for Financial Education.
